page.title: 19Memories of Hook
page.content: {The Blacksmith's Arms}is so named because the{Blacksmith}had his shop behind the {public house.}Nearly every cottage had its own cow but fresh milk could be bought from the{farms. }Now there are no cows in the village and milk is delivered from {Goole.}People could travel from the village into {Goole}by horse drawn bus twice a week on Wednesdays and Saturdays.Every Sunday the {Mail Coach }thundered through the village and all the young children ran into their houses because they were frightened.In{1919}a {Memorial Hall}was built as a{Memorial} to the people who died in the{First {World War.}Lord Montague donated the land and the money for the building was raised by the{villagers.}When{Mrs. {Belton}attended the{village}school she had to curtsey to the{Headmaster}every morning.{Mr.Belton}had to bow to him.
